column5: I took the 8am ferry to Ward's Island.  While I was in the ferry, there was a VERY nice lady with a dog sitting across me.  She politely asked if I was going to fish.  Then she suddenly "ordered" me to move away.  I asked her why, and she replied, "Why are you killing all the fish?  You know fishing kill will kill things right?"  She then asked me again, "Can you go paint a bamboo as a hobby?  Painting a bamboo will not kill~!"  I just ignored her and moved on.   An interesting way to start my fishing day..... After I arrived, I immediately started to cast my lures.  Saw several Bass and one Pike cruising along the shore.  I tried to target Pike until 12pm, then I changed to target Carp.  I was using corn under a float, after the corn enter the water, the Carp started to appear.  I was getting all excited since my corn attracted them to group around.  But then I realized there's something wrong.  They were circling my float as if they were dancing a "We don't wanna eat your corn dance".  Then I saw some bottom disturbance close to shore so I slowly reel my corn to the area, within a second, my float went under..... I was all excited, then I saw a bullhead.  Overall I caught two bullheads, 13 inches and 15 inches.  At least I caught something today............  I'll for sure go back and try my Pike again  The lovely Toronto Downtown  A huge dead pike  Reeling in the 13 inches bullhead  The 15 inches bullhead
ok thanks for the report  regarding 'avoid the lady with dog'
And I bet that nice "lady" never killed a single thing in her life, not even a virus.  Sheesh.
thnx for report, ull get em soon...
hmm that cat looks pregnant.  or could it be all the corn I stuff him with. Yeah the carp are getting tougher in there.  Nice fat cat.  dsn
I went this after noon targeting pike, managed 1 only, clean and nice, but small.  Carp are starting to spawn, they are in there now, tough to catch, mostly on the surface.
gee wonder what gave it away!
I would have asked her if you could borrow her dog for a wee while...

LOL about that lady with the dog...should have told her that even though it looks like a fishing rod, it's the latest in fencing gear.  Then go to jab her dog and see what she does... j/k of course.  Sorry to hear about the carp....but that 15" bullhead sure is a big ulgy fish!!! When I'm being skunked, I'll throw a worm on a hook and bottom fish...most times I pull a bullhead out...makes me feel better....haha.  Great report!
I would have told her Jesus was a fisherman and was she insinuating that he was cruel and heartless? HH
